title: Hypothesis identification - pH and fish survival

content.description: Scientists want to investigate whether the increased concentration of carbon dioxide in the ocean affects fish survival. Scientists suspect immature fish larvae may be most affected by increased carbon dioxide concentrations.
content.question: Which of the following best identifies a testable hypothesis for the investigation?

choices.label: The decreasing <math alttext="p H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of the ocean water will decrease the survivorship of fish.
The decreasing temperature of the ocean water will increase the survivorship of fish larvae.
There will be a greater percentage of fish larvae that survive than mature fish that survive.
The increasing carbon dioxide concentrations will increase the density of adult fish skeletons.

content.answer: The decreasing <math alttext="p H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of the ocean water will decrease the survivorship of fish.

skill.text: Skill 4.A: Identify a testable hypothesis or scientific question for an investigation.
